input_text:
Job Title: Customs Compliance Specialist

Location: Norwell, MA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
Job Description

The Transportation Compliance Specialist reports directly to the Director of Transportation Compliance and is responsible for providing governance of all imports and exports for all of the Company's divisions administering cross-border moves of equipment, vehicles, specialty items, tools, electronics, waste, chemicals, etc. Assist all departments and divisions are following the approved standard operating procedures (SOPs), submitting the correct documentation, accurately and completely, to the customs broker and/or Customs Border Patrols.

This position does require the successful candidate to be on call and work overtime as required.

Why work for Clean Harbors?

 Health and Safety is our #1 priority and we live it 3-6-5!  Competitive wages  Comprehensive health benefits coverage after 30 days of full-time employment  Group 401K with company matching component  Generous paid time off, company paid training and tuition reimbursement  Positive and safe work environments  Opportunities for growth and development for all the stages of your career 

Responsibilities

 Work with legal team to investigate and resolve current and potential customs issues.  Assist Administrator cross-border moves of equipment, vehicles, specialty items, tools, electronics, waste, chemicals, etc.  Develop, implement, and maintain company-wide cross border SOPs, incorporating changes in international regulations and company needs.  Create company-wide standard documents/forms and ensure that all cross-border moves comply with all government regulations and follow-up paperwork is submitted in a timely manner.  Research, develop, and manage all customs broker vendor relationships.  Work in close collaboration with internal departments to ensure strict compliance adherence in all countries where the Company does business. 

Qualifications

H.S Diploma/ GED Required

 Outstanding influencing, interpersonal, and communication (written/verbal) skills.  Individual must be able to manage from afar and keep control over this functional area.  Ability to adhere to deadlines and adjust accordingly and work under pressure.  Meticulous attention to detail and ability to quickly prioritize.  Strong systems skills required (Excel, Access, and proprietary software systems.)  Position requires working with all levels of management from CEO to local office administrators, recognizing and applying good judgment.  Experience working in a large organization in a role requiring cross functional cooperation, influencing individuals at administrative and executive levels, and attention to detail.  Verifiable experience responsible for managing the import and export of vehicles, equipment and commercial goods.  Ability to conceptualize and implement new programs and processes, as well as develop and implement strategies to meet business needs. 

Excellent leadership and presentation skills. Position requires regular interaction with senior and executive management.

#CH

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Customs Compliance Specialist
output_json.summary: The Transportation Compliance Specialist reports directly to the Director of Transportation Compliance and is responsible for providing governance of all imports and exports.

Assist Administrator cross-border moves of equipment, vehicles, specialty items, tools, electronics, waste, chemicals, etc.
Develop, implement, and maintain company-wide cross border SOPs, incorporating changes in international regulations and company needs.
Create company-wide standard documents/forms and ensure that all cross-border moves comply with all government regulations and follow-up paperwork is submitted in a timely manner.
Research, develop, and manage all customs broker vendor relationships.
Work in close collaboration with internal departments to ensure strict compliance adherence in all countries where the Company does business.
